translations.text: A beseecher besought the visitation of chastisement,<sup foot_note="182286">1</sup>
(a chastisement meant) for the unbelievers, one which none can avert;
a chastisement from Allah, the Lord of the ascending steps,<sup foot_note="182287">1</sup>
by which the angels and the Spirit<sup foot_note="182288">1</sup> ascend to Him<sup foot_note="182289">2</sup> in one Day the duration of which is fifty thousand years.<sup foot_note="182290">3</sup>
So, (O Prophet), persevere with gracious perseverance.<sup foot_note="182291">1</sup>
Verily they think that the chastisement is far off,
while We think that it is near at hand.<sup foot_note="182292">1</sup>
It shall befall on a Day<sup foot_note="182293">1</sup> whereon the sky will become like molten brass,<sup foot_note="182294">2</sup>
and the mountains will become like dyed tufts of wool,<sup foot_note="182295">1</sup>
and no bosom friend will enquire about any of his bosom friends
although they shall be within sight of one another.<sup foot_note="182296">1</sup> The guilty one would fain ransom himself from the torment of that Day by offering his children,
and his spouse and his brother,
and his kinsfolk who had stood by him,
and all persons of the earth, if only he could thus save himself.
By no means! It will be the fierce flame
that will strip off the scalp.
It shall insistently summon him who turned his back and retreated,
and amassed wealth and covetously hoarded it.<sup foot_note="182297">1</sup>
Verily man is impatient by nature:<sup foot_note="182298">1</sup>
bewailing when evil befalls him,
and tight-fisted when good fortune visits him,
except those that pray,<sup foot_note="182299">1</sup>
and are constant in their Prayer;<sup foot_note="182300">1</sup>
and those in whose wealth there is a known right
for those that ask and those that are dispossessed,<sup foot_note="182301">1</sup>
those who firmly believe in the Day of Recompense,<sup foot_note="182302">1</sup>
and fear the chastisement of their Lord<sup foot_note="182303">1</sup>–
surely the chastisement of their Lord is a thing none can feel secure from –
and those who guard their private parts,<sup foot_note="182304">1</sup>
except in regard to their spouses and those whom their right hands possess, for in regard to them they are not reproachable,<sup foot_note="182305">1</sup>
but any who seeks to go beyond that, it is indeed they who are the transgressors,
and those who fulfil their trusts and their covenants,<sup foot_note="182306">1</sup>
and those who are upright in their testimonies;<sup foot_note="182307">1</sup>
and who take due care of their Prayer:<sup foot_note="182308">1</sup>
all these shall live honourably in the Gardens.
But what is the matter with the unbelievers who are hurrying towards you
in crowds, both on the right and on the left?<sup foot_note="182309">1</sup>
Does everyone of them wish to enter the Garden of Bliss?<sup foot_note="182310">1</sup>
By no means! They know that which We have created them from.<sup foot_note="182311">1</sup>
I swear<sup foot_note="182312">1</sup> by the Lord of the easts and the wests<sup foot_note="182313">2</sup> that We have the power
to replace them by others who would be better than they; and We shall certainly not be overpowered.<sup foot_note="182314">1</sup>
So leave them to engage in vain talk and to amuse themselves until they come face to face with the Day which they are promised,
the Day on which they will hastily come forth from their graves, as though they were hurrying on to the altars of their deities.<sup foot_note="182315">1</sup>
Their eyes will be downcast and disgrace will overwhelm them. Such is the Day that they were promised.
